name: Jupiter and its Galilean Moons
description: Observation of Jupiter showing all four Galilean moons: Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto. Jupiter's Great Red Spot was clearly visible.

name: Andromeda Galaxy Deep Sky
description: Extended exposure observation of the Andromeda Galaxy (M31) revealing spiral structure and companion galaxies M32 and M110.

name: Saturn's Rings at Opposition
description: Saturn observation at opposition showing ring system at maximum tilt. Cassini Division clearly visible. Titan also observed.

name: Orion Nebula Complex
description: Observation of the Orion Nebula (M42) and surrounding nebulosity. The Trapezium cluster resolved into individual stars.

name: Lunar Eclipse Total Phase
description: Total lunar eclipse observation. Moon displayed deep red color during totality. Eclipse duration: 85 minutes.

name: Comet 12P/Pons-Brooks
description: Observation of periodic comet 12P showing well-developed coma and short tail. Magnitude approximately 6.5.

name: Mars Surface Features
description: High-resolution observation of Mars showing polar ice cap and dark surface features including Syrtis Major.

name: Pleiades Star Cluster
description: Wide-field observation of the Pleiades (M45) showing blue reflection nebulosity around the brightest stars.

name: Venus Crescent Phase
description: Venus observation showing distinct crescent phase at 35% illumination. Surface brightness very high.

name: Whirlpool Galaxy
description: Observation of M51 (Whirlpool Galaxy) and companion NGC 5195. Spiral arms clearly visible in both galaxies.

name: International Space Station Transit
description: ISS transit across the face of the Moon captured. Transit duration: 0.8 seconds. Excellent visibility.

name: Ring Nebula in Lyra
description: Observation of M57 (Ring Nebula) showing classic ring structure. Central star visible with averted vision.

name: Mercury at Greatest Elongation
description: Rare observation of Mercury at greatest eastern elongation. Planet visible low on western horizon after sunset.

name: Hercules Globular Cluster
description: Deep observation of M13 (Great Hercules Cluster) resolving thousands of individual stars in the core region.

name: Summer Triangle Asterism
description: Wide-field observation showing Vega, Deneb, and Altair forming the Summer Triangle. Milky Way visible between stars.
